result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T. Gingrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice for Costs - Unable to Forward per USPS
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

1:36 PM case called. Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew T. Gingrich in court with Attorney Katherine Cook. Agreement has been reached. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine Repeater.
Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court withholds sentence and orders:
18 months probation
60 days jail with Huber if available, stayed pending further order of the court 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court costs. 

2 days of jail credit if revoked.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas and orders 20 days for motions.
